sentences.english: That evening when she entered the theatre the manager had a most pleasant greeting for her.
sentences.chinese: 那天晚上，當她走進戲院時，經理極其和悅地招呼她。

sentences.english: The famous actor is now appearing in Hamlet at the Grand Theatre.
sentences.chinese: 這位名演員正在大戲院演出《哈姆雷特》。

sentences.english: The popularity of television and the difficulty of financing plays have helped to close many theatres.
sentences.chinese: 電視的普及以及戲劇籌資的困難迫使許多戲院關了門。

sentences.english: Kennedy was shot from a warehouse and his assassin ran and hid in a theater.
sentences.chinese: 刺客躲在倉庫裏暗殺甘迺迪後逃走躲進一間戲院裏。

sentences.english: The magician's tricks mystified the audience in the theater.
sentences.chinese: 魔術師的小把戲唬住了戲院的每個聽衆。

sentences.english: South of the city theater, clock is dressed as a girl selling cigarettes.
sentences.chinese: 城南戲院裏，鍾離打扮成一個賣煙姑娘。

sentences.english: In the theater of celebrity tragedy, each play has three acts.
sentences.chinese: 在上演名流悲劇的戲院裏，每一齣戲都有三幕。

sentences.english: A small airless theatre crammed with child ren.
sentences.chinese: 一家擠滿小孩的不通風的小戲院。

sentences.english: There is a long queue outsides the theater.
Be careful not to disarrange the coiffures in row in front when you take your seat in a theatre.
sentences.chinese: 當你進戲院就位時，不要把前排觀衆的頭髮碰亂。

sentences.english: The theater was full, and many people had to be turned away.
sentences.chinese: 戲院擠滿了人，許多觀衆不得其門而入。

sentences.english: There were crowds of people at the theatre.
sentences.chinese: 戲院裏聚着一羣一羣的人。

sentences.english: Raoul tries to tell her there is no Phantom of the Opera.
sentences.chinese: 拉烏包爾試着告訴她說沒有戲院魅影。

sentences.english: The taxi discharged its passengers at the theatre.
sentences.chinese: 出租車停在戲院門口，讓乘客下車。

sentences.english: They got separated in the crowded theater.
sentences.chinese: 在擁擠的戲院裏他們走散了。

sentences.english: The entertainment at the new theater changes nightly.
sentences.chinese: 那家新戲院的演出節目每晚都換。

definition: filled to capacity (of theater, stadium, gymnasium etc)
in those days/then/in those years/during that time
shopping mall/shopping center/department store/emporium/CL:家[jia1]/the business world
script for play, opera, movie etc/screenplay/scenario
to close a door/to lock a door/(of a shop etc) to close (for the night, or permanently)
